titlestmt.titleproper: Richard D. Butterfield Slide and Photograph Collection
Richard D. Butterfield Slide and Photograph Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Sarah Coe

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:11

did.unittitle: Richard D. Butterfield Slide and Photograph Collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of photographs and slides taken by R. D. Butterfield from 1952-1983, and donated to the Visual Resources Collection at the encouragement of Abbott Lowell Cummings. Most are architectural studies, with particular emphasis on Venice's Grand Canal, Palladio and his influence, New England churches, and churches by Christopher Wren. Mr. Butterfield was a practicing architect, M.Arch. Yale, based in Farmington, CT. He died in 1986. Mr. Butterfield was interested in comparisons between British and European architecture and New England architecture, and had an exhibit at the New Britain Museum of American Art in 1983, "Towers From-The-Ground-Up," on that subject. The exhibit is thoroughly documented in this collection. Palladio's influence on American architecture is also explored, as is Wren's. All slides have been carefully labeled according to Mr. Butterfield's numbering system, and his slide index is enclosed with the collection in Box 26. Many of them are also briefly identified on the slide mounts. The photos are of very high quality, although some of the film has faded. The index details the year the photo was taken, the subject, the camera and film, and sometimes even the time of day.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Further use of this material may be subject to the copyright laws of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms or conditions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard D. Butterfield Slide and Photograph Collection, Arts Library, Yale University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of photographs and slides taken by R. D. Butterfield from 1952-1983, and donated to the Visual Resources Collection at the encouragement of Abbott Lowell Cummings. Most are architectural studies, with particular emphasis on Venice's Grand Canal, Palladio and his influence, New England churches, and churches by Christopher Wren.

Mr. Butterfield was a practicing architect, M.Arch. Yale, based in Farmington, CT. He died in 1986. Mr. Butterfield was interested in comparisons between British and European architecture and New England architecture, and had an exhibit at the New Britain Museum of American Art in 1983, "Towers From-The-Ground-Up," on that subject. The exhibit is thoroughly documented in this collection. Palladio's influence on American architecture is also explored, as is Wren's.

All slides have been carefully labeled according to Mr. Butterfield's numbering system, and his slide index is enclosed with the collection in Box 26. Many of them are also briefly identified on the slide mounts. The photos are of very high quality, although some of the film has faded. The index details the year the photo was taken, the subject, the camera and film, and sometimes even the time of day.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Related material is grouped together, and as much as possible, remains in Mr. Butterfield's original order. See below for a detailed listing. It is recommended that anyone using these slides also recall Box 26, which contains Butterfield's slide index.

odd.head: General
odd.p: (ca. 14,900 35mm slides, 414 70mm slides, 52 sets of paired 70mm slides, 696 photographs, 52 contact sheets with corresponding negatives, 66 sheets of negatives without contact sheets)

odd.head: General
odd.p: 21 boxes. From box marked "Edited. Some boxes to Bryce." Slides appear to be leftovers, and mostly from ca. 1952. All boxes have full identification noted on the outsides. Many of these photos are family snapshots, building sites, etc.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 24 boxes. From box marked "Edited. Some boxes to Bryce." Slides are from 1952-1953. All boxes have full identification noted on the outsides. Many of these photos are family snapshots, building sites, etc.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 26 boxes. From box marked "Edited. Some boxes to Bryce." Slides are from 1953-1954. All boxes have full identification noted on the outsides. Many of these photos are family photos, building sites, etc.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 24 boxes. All boxes have full identification noted on the outsides. Slides are from 1954. Many of these photos are family photos, building sites, etc.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 21 boxes. All boxes have full identification noted on the outsides. Slides are from 1954, 1955, 1957. Many of these photos are family photos, building sites, etc.

did.unittitle: Slide boxes: LQ, LS, LY, ZU-ZY (ca. 300 35mm slides)

odd.head: General
odd.p: 12 boxes. Slides are from 1957 (family photos), 1964 (London). There are also two boxes of slides culled from various rolls of South Carolina, New York, Minnesota, and Maryland.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 13 boxes. Slides are from 1964, and include architecture of Paris, Meudon, London, Florence, S. Gimignano, Siena, and Rome.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 14 boxes. Slides are from 1964 and 1965, and include architecture of Rome, Sorrento, Paestum, London, and Cambridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 13 boxes. Slides are from 1965-1966, and include architecture of Cambridge, London, Venice, Paris, Chartres.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 26 boxes. Slides are from 1968-1969, and include personal photos, New England, English church prints, Rome, and Venice.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 17 boxes. Slides are from 1969, and include architecture from Rome, Venice, and the beginning of London.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 15 boxes. All Slides are from 1969, and include personal photos and various cities and towns in Britain.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 26 boxes. All Slides are from 1969-1970, and include personal photos, construction sites, and New England buildings.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 15 boxes. Slides are from 1970, and include Venice, Portofino, Nice, and other scenes from Southern France.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 14 boxes. Slides are from 1970, and include Southern France, various chateaux, Versailles, and the return to the United States.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 11 boxes. Slides are from 1971, and are of architecture in Britain, and a box culled from various rolls labeled "Venice Project."

odd.head: General
odd.p: 17 boxes. Slides are from 1971, and include personal photos, architecture in Winchester, London, and various other locations in Britain, and Venice.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 22 boxes. Slides are from 1971-1972, and include personal photos, job sites, and New England architecture.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 20 boxes. Slides are from 1972-1974 and 1981, and include personal photos, job sites, and New England architecture.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 18 boxes. Slides are from 1981-1982, and include architecture in Virginia, New England, and Christopher Wren churches in Oxford and London.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 20 boxes. Slides are from 1982, and include architecture in New England and London.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 18 boxes. Slides are from 1982-1983 and 1985, and include personal photos, architecture in London, Venice, other places in Britain, and New England.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 9 boxes. Slides are from 1985, and include architecture in New England.

odd.head: General
odd.p: 25 boxes. Slides are from 1967-1968, and include personal photos and job sites. These slides do not seem to be listed in detail in Mr. Butterfield's catalogue.
